conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine motion direction.
Vertical axis represents velocity; horizontal axis represents time.
Positive velocity indicates positive direction; negative velocity indicates negative direction.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity is -2 m/s.
Velocity transitions from 0 to -2 m/s from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds.
Negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
Defined positive direction is associated with positive velocity values.
Since velocity is negative, the particle is moving opposite to the defined positive direction.
